fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira UI looks distorted for *{{Menu}}* options whenever the {{websudo}} module's '*drop access*' link in the banner displayed at the top of the {{Admin}} user access login screen.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the new Jira 8.13
 # Login with {{Admin}} access
 # Try to use the JIRA administration screens which require to enter the password again such as {{Jira Administration - > System}}
 # Navigate to UI such as {{Issues}}, {{Projects}}

h3. Expected Results

UI should look normal. Please refer to the below screenshot from the earlier versions.
Please refer to the below screenshot.
( +*Jira 8.11, 8.12.PNG*+)
h3. Actual Results

Jira's UI looks distorted by having gaps when clicked on {{Menu}} options.
 Please refer to the attached screenshots.
(+*IssuesMenu.PNG, ProjectsMenu.PNG*+)
h3. Workaround

This issue is not reproducible when the {{websudo}} module is disabled.

For disabling the {{websudo}}, It is required to put the following parameter
{code:java}
jira.websudo.is.disabled = true
{code}
into a *jira-config.properties* file and restart Jira.
fields.summary: Jira UI looks distorted for Menu options whenever the websudo module's 'drop access' link in the banner displayed at the top of the Admin user access login screen.

fields.description:
Bulk Operation for subtasks only offers edit, move, transition, delete and watching.

What's missing is a handy function to clone a set of subtasks and select a target issue where they should be moved into.
fields.summary: Cloning subtasks to another issue for Bulk Operation

fields.description:
Request to add the following to this documentation article:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/adding-a-custom-event-938847495.html:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When there is a screen where only the comment field will be present when using that screen in a transition on a desktop. The same transition in Jira mobile does not have this screen. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a screen
# Remove all custom fields
# Associate the screen with a workflow transition
# Transition a ticket

h3. Expected Results

* Be prompted to add a comment before the transition completes

h3. Actual Results

* The issue transitions immediately

h3. Workaround

Comment on the issue before transitioning
fields.summary: Transitioning an issue with a screen that has no custom fields (just a comment box) in Jira mobile does not prompt for a comment before completing the transition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we start the Reindex process using the REST API {{/rest/api/2/reindex?type=FOREGROUND}}, the index snapshot is still able to run on other nodes, which results in corrupt snapshots.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start both JIRA nodes
# Schedule the index snapshot to run
# Initiate full locked reindex at Node1 a few minutes before the snapshot:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
curl  -X POST http://127.0.0.1:8091/rest/api/2/reindex?type=FOREGROUND
{code}
# Notice that the snapshot still happens on Node2

h3. Expected Results

The index snapshot should not run while the reindex is running.
It should either queue it up and wait for the reindex to finish, or simply handle as a conflict and not run the snapshot.

h3. Actual Results

The index snapshot runs while the reindex is running.

h3. Workaround

* When calling the reindex, make sure that the snapshot is not scheduled to run in the next minutes/hours
* Or make sure to start it from the UI, instead of the API.
fields.summary: Starting a foreground reindex using the REST API could corrupt a snapshot

fields.description:
In Jira 8.5.x and before, the Advanced Search box in the issue Navigator used all the available horizontal space.

But after upgrading to Jira 8.11.1, the search box is limited and leaves some very valuable real-estate unused between the search button and the columns/list-detail view controls.
fields.summary: Maximize advanced search box size in issue Navigator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When clicking on any users on the Versions page (<JIRA>/projects/<PROJECT_KEY/versions/<VERSION_KEY>) results on being redirected to the profile page of the userkey, instead of the username of the user. This only happens on the Versions page, and only with users that have different userkeys and usernames.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on any user on the Versions page, that has a different userkey and username.
 # Jira redirects to the profile page of the userkey, showing a "The specified user could not be found." error.

h3. Expected Results
Jira redirects to the proper profile page.
h3. Actual Results
Jira is redirecting to the profile page of the userkey.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Clicking on a username on the Versions page redirects to a wrong profile

fields.description:
Affected versions of Jira Server allow remote unauthenticated attackers to enumerate issue keys via a missing permissions check in the ActionsAndOperations resource.


The affected versions are before 7.13.18, from version 8.0.0 before 8.5.9, and from version 8.6.0 before version 8.12.2.


*_Affected versions:_*
 * version < 7.13.18
 * 8.0.0 ≤ version < 7.13.18
* 8.6.0 ≤ version < 8.12.2


*_Fixed versions:_*
 * 7.13.18
 * 8.5.9
 * 8.12.2
fields.summary: Unauthenticated user can Enumerate Issue Keys - CVE-2020-14185

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira nodes experience poor performance due to contention with the ProjectRoleActorsZduSafeCache.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

N/A
h3. Expected Results

Jira will experience no-cache contention for _*ProjectRoleActorsZduSafeCache*_
h3. Actual Results

Thread dumps will show a high number of threads waiting on _*ProjectRoleActorsZduSafeCache*_
{noformat}
for var in $(ls *thread*); do printf "%s\n" "$var"; awk -v RS= -v ORS='\n\n' '/com.atlassian.jira.security.roles.ProjectRoleActorsZduSafeCache.get/{print}' $var | awk 'NR==1;/^$/{getline;print}' | wc -l; done
jira_threads.txt
     108
jira_threads.txt
     102
jira_threads.txt
      86
jira_threads.txt
      85
jira_threads.txt
      90
jira_threads.txt
      91
{noformat}
_Sample thread:_
{code:java}
https-jsse-nio-8443-exec-1 
jdk.internal.misc.Unsafe.park(java.base@11.0.8/Native Method)
java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(java.base@11.0.8/LockSupport.java:194)
java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.parkAndCheckInterrupt(java.base@11.0.8/AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:885)
java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireQueued(java.base@11.0.8/AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:917)
java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquire(java.base@11.0.8/AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1240)
java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock.lock(java.base@11.0.8/ReentrantLock.java:267)
com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.localq.tape.TapeLocalQCacheOpQueue.isClosed(TapeLocalQCacheOpQueue.java:111)
com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.localq.LocalQCacheOpQueueWithStats.isClosed(LocalQCacheOpQueueWithStats.java:89)
com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.localq.LocalQCacheManager.addToAllQueues(LocalQCacheManager.java:357)
com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.localq.LocalQCacheReplicator.replicateToQueue(LocalQCacheReplicator.java:85)
com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.localq.LocalQCacheReplicator.replicateRemovalNotification(LocalQCacheReplicator.java:71)
com.atlassian.jira.cluster.cache.ehcache.AbstractJiraCacheReplicator.notifyElementRemoved(AbstractJiraCacheReplicator.java:78)
net.sf.ehcache.event.RegisteredEventListeners.internalNotifyElementRemoved(RegisteredEventListeners.java:156)
net.sf.ehcache.event.RegisteredEventListeners.notifyElementRemoved(RegisteredEventListeners.java:136)
 net.sf.ehcache.Cache.notifyRemoveInternalListeners(Cache.java:2449)
 net.sf.ehcache.Cache.removeInternal(Cache.java:2423)
 net.sf.ehcache.Cache.remove(Cache.java:2325)
 net.sf.ehcache.Cache.remove(Cache.java:2243)
net.sf.ehcache.constructs.EhcacheDecoratorAdapter.remove(EhcacheDecoratorAdapter.java:155)
com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.SynchronizedLoadingCacheDecorator.remove(SynchronizedLoadingCacheDecorator.java:62)
net.sf.ehcache.constructs.EhcacheDecoratorAdapter.remove(EhcacheDecoratorAdapter.java:155)
 com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.remove(LoadingCache.java:195)
com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.DelegatingCache.remove(DelegatingCache.java:146)
com.atlassian.jira.cache.DeferredReplicationCache.lambda$remove$2(DeferredReplicationCache.java:74)
com.atlassian.jira.cache.DeferredReplicationCache$$Lambda$1712/0x0000000802e2b840.get(Unknown Source)
com.atlassian.jira.cluster.cache.ehcache.BlockingParallelCacheReplicator.runDeferred(BlockingParallelCacheReplicator.java:172)
com.atlassian.jira.cache.DeferredReplicationCache.remove(DeferredReplicationCache.java:73)
com.atlassian.jira.security.roles.ProjectRoleActorsZduSafeCache$1$$Lambda$14865/0x0000000801cd3840.accept(Unknown Source)
{code}
 
h3. Workaround

Upgrade to Jira 8.12.2 onwards as this contains the fix. 
h3. Background

We had a call with the author of the changes who was able to give us some background on this. 
 There was a need to optimize the role actors for given project cache by rewriting it (too much data being deleted on cache eviction). This solved https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-69446. The ProjectRoleActorsZduSafeCache class has been introduced to make it work when Jira is in a mixed mode, during the ZDU. Unfortunately it caused some problems with cache replication between the old and new cache and in some cases unnecessary cache invalidations.
h3. Proposed way of testing if the Jira upgrade will solve the problem

The problem should be present only when there are a lot of project role actors modifications. The client could setup Jira 8.11.1 and trigger a lot of such operations (e.g. by some automation), upgrade, e.g. to 8.13, do the test again and see if the problem persists.
fields.summary: Poor Performance due to ProjectRoleActorsZduSafeCache

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Right now, '@' mentions follow a different logic than the one specified on the project Notification scheme, and thus it is not possible to customize when the notification should be sent or not.

Similarly to what's requested on [Ability to disable the @mention notifications for a specific project|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-71381], Jira should have further customization for the @ mention notifications.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using your mobile device and accessing a Jira link, it should automatically open in the Jira Mobile browser instead of the web browser.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Open a Jira link on the mobile app. 
h3. Actual Results

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

fields.description:

h3. Actual Results

We need to refresh the screen to reflect the change in the card colour
{noformat}
...
{noformat}

Refresh the screen.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Whenever a linked issue is created using the *Create linked issue* functionality, its priority will match the original issue's priority instead of the one selected as the default priority in the issue priority scheme.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access an issue.
 # Click on *More* > *Create linked issues*.
 # Fill out the details but do not select a priority.
 # Click on *Create*.

h3. Expected Results
* The linked issue's priority should be the one specified in the Issue Priority Scheme.

 !Screen Shot 2020-10-07 at 23.32.34.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* The linked issue's priority is equal to the priority of the issue where the *Create linked issue* functionality was used.

 !Screen Shot 2020-10-07 at 23.31.18.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Manually select the linked issue's priority if it is displayed on the *Create Issue Screen*.
fields.summary: Linked issues created through the "Create Linked Issue" option do not respect the default priority selected in the project's priority scheme.

fields.description:
This ticket documents an improvement to the Velocity Uberspector's security, locking down which classes can be accessed. This change is a defence-in-depth against potential Remote Code Execution (RCE) and Injection attacks.

The versions which do not have this improvement are before version 8.12.3.

*Pre-improvement versions:*
 * version < 8.12.3

*Improved versions:*
 * 8.12.3
 * 8.13.0
 * 8.14.0
fields.summary: Security improvements to the Velocity Uberspector

fields.description:
I would appreciate function for set customfield name for project scope in Custom Field configuration or Customfield context

For example scenario:

Problem manager has container *Project problem* and he need new customfield name "Problem start" so we created new date Customfield "Problem start"
Week later Test manager need new customfield "Test iteration start" in project *Test iterations*, but he wants exactly this name in screen...
week later Service Desk agent new customfield "*Predicted resolution date"* in project Service desk requests...

After 3 weeks we have 3 customfields in 3 separated containters, all of them are Date fields, not used in more than One exact project, because their name is so Unique, than nobody else can use them, because their orientation is for one specific use Case.

BUT

IF I could create customfield named: "Date" and set in Field Config schema or context his personalizated name for some scope....

We would have 1 customfield with 3 separated names for many usecases. 
There are BIG Jira implementations, where corporates generate customfields in hundreds (100 text fields in instance is normal...) but all of this is caused because manager need exact name on screen or export.

In architecture of JIRA, there is one conjuctive unique identificator and it is ID of Customfield, We can create many customfields with identical name and different type, so why I can not change Name in scope of project? or issueType?

Advantage: optimalization and performance of database
minimalization generation fields in Jira with one purpose...
reusing existing fields

Disadvantege: JQL name, export name orientation

nowadays I know workaround and it is Script runner Behaviour. But it is not solution, because many times I can not run JS on all screens and set up context. Export is with origin name, JQL as well.
fields.summary: Customizable Customfield name for project

fields.description: As a JIRA administrator, I want to be able to disable priority values ​​in priority schemes in order to keep values ​​for old tickets and use new ones for new tickets. It would be great to have this functionality similar to disabling values ​​for select list custom field.
fields.summary: An option to disable the priority value in Jira

fields.description:
+*Summary:*+

The customers would like to have the feature where option to see list of projects from "*summary page of an archived project" should be redirected to BrowseProject URL* with search box enabled.

+*Steps to Reproduce:*+
 Step 1: Archive any project
 Step 2: Go to 'https://jira-stab-dcqa.qualcomm.com/jira/plugins/servlet/project-config/\{ProjectKey}/summary page of archived project
 Step 3: Click on 'here' link to see list of all projects.

+*Verified in Versions*+: 8.6.0 and 8.11.0

+*Actual Results*+:

The link in the summary page redirects to [https://jira-stab-dcqa.qualcomm.com/jira/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa] (It doesn't have search box).

+*Expected Behaviour as per request:*+

It should refer to [https://jira-stab-dcqa.qualcomm.com/jira/secure/project/BrowseProjects.jspa?s=view_projects] (should have search box).
fields.summary: Option to view list of all projects from summary page of an archived project should redirect to BrowseProjects URL instead of ViewProjects URL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Calendar functionality is broken when inserting an invalid date format

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a ticket
# Click on *_Admin > Add Field_*
# Select a date field
# Click on *Edit field*
# Insert an invalid date like "aaaaa"
# Click on *Submit*
# Jira will throw an "_Invalid date format. Please enter the date in the format..._"
# Click on the calendar icon to select the correct date

h3. Expected Results
The calendar should be displayed so we can select a valid date 

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens (even if we clean up the field)

h3. Workaround
Edit the date field through the *Edit* button
fields.summary: The Calendar functionality is broken when inserting an invalid date format

fields.description:
Customers would like to be able of narrow down the users that appear as options when adding them on a reporter field. 

Currently, every user on JIRA can be set as a reporter, even if they are not able of logging into JIRA.
fields.summary: Ability to add user filtering on default Reporter field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user does not have Browse user Global permission they have to enter user_key to select administrators for boards. It also allows selecting inactive users.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user with all project and board permission and *remove Browse user Global permission*
 # Go to the specific board->configure->Administrators 
 # select users

h3. Expected Results

Users should be able to add users by entering the user-name. And inactive users should not be allowed. User picker fields of this page should be changed
h3. Actual Results

Users have to enter the user key, which is not present on UI. And any inactive user can be added with a user key
h3. Workaround

Required, Enter the user-key referring database.
fields.summary: Users have to enter user_key to select administrators for boards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Due to cache corruption, it leads to show "No data available" in devstatus panel instead bitbucket information

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - We are not able to reproducible on demand.

h3. Expected Results
 - DevStatus Panel should show the Bitbucket information.

h3. Actual Results
 - The below exception is thrown in the log file:
{code:java}
2020-09-11 10:59:41,454+0000 catalina-exec-71 DEBUG xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx 659x8334510x6 hdfcsd 222.11.2.33,333.88.444.223 /rest/dev-status/1.0/issue/summary [c.a.j.p.devstatus.impl.DefaultDevStatusPermissionService] VIEW_DEV_TOOLS permission check failed for user xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx(xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx) on issue SSSPP1-1617

Restrict jira users groups with application access to be listed in Filter Subscription

fields.description:
If errors occur in the application, error messages are displayed. Some problems arise for partially sighted and blind users:
 ▪ Blind users can hardly perceive the messages because they are not in the label of the form fields and are therefore not output by the screen reader in form mode.
 ▪ In addition, these are implemented like help texts behind the element concerned and are only highlighted in color. Visually impaired users with color ametropia will have problems recognizing the message. The color adjustment will also not be visible in the contrast adjustment.
 ▪ When editing an issue, the problem arises that incorrect data is deleted without the user becoming aware of it. If, for example, a sprint name that does not exist is entered and the user submits the form ("update"), this is saved and the value is removed. This means that users will not recognize errors and will enter incomplete data.
fields.summary: It is difficult to identify and correct errors.

fields.description:
All dynamic changes within a dialog mask that do not trigger a complete reload of the page may be recognized by the screen reader. not noticed. The following problems occur:
 The window for editing the current filter details of issues does not get focus when opened. Keyboard users cannot edit filters and have to create a new filter.

 

Drop-down lists for filtering search results cannot be usefully operated with the keyboard. Blind and motor-impaired users have the problem that after activating an option, the focus is set in the background, the search result is updated and the list is not closed. In order to set further filter options from this list, these users have to navigate back to activate the next option.

The change in the status of an issue is only indicated by a fly-in message, which is not output by the screen reader. Blind users therefore have to navigate through the content with a slight additional effort in order to see the current status .

 

In some pop-ups the problem arises that the focus is not set on the first interactive element after opening, e.g. when creating a new issue (see figure, marker A). Keyboard users therefore have to navigate to the previous content with additional effort. Blind users also have the problem that it cannot be seen that and how many elements are in front of the current position within the pop-up.
 If a project is selected when creating an issue, the focus is then set on the "Summary" input field. Interactive elements are skipped. Keyboard users have to go back with additional effort to reach these elements.

In all areas of the application the problem arises that after closing pop-ups or reloading the page, e.g. after a status change of a process on the view page, the focus is set to the top of the page. This means that keyboard users have to navigate to previously focused content with additional effort.
fields.summary: Updates are sometimes difficult to use.

fields.description:
Motor-impaired and blind users who cannot use the mouse can navigate using the tab key. Is navigated to an element directly, i. H. Without further input, an action carried out, users cannot specifically control this action. Since each element is reached in a specific order when navigating with the keyboard, users want u. You may just skip an element, but not carry out the associated action every time.
 One such problem occurs in the agile boards. When navigating through the activities in the swim lanes, the details area on the right-hand side (if shown) is updated for each focused activity. However, this area cannot be reached with an access key, so that keyboard users in this area can only display and access the last process on the board. This function can therefore not be used by keyboard users.
fields.summary: Issue details cannot be accessed from the agile boards using the keyboard.

fields.description:
Screen readers offer the possibility of outputting all the links on a page one after the other. This enables a blind user to quickly gain an overview of the navigation structure and, if necessary, to switch directly to another page without having to display the entire content every time. In the entire application, however, some links are not clearly labeled so that blind users cannot recognize the function. Affected are i.a. the following elements :
 ▪ the pagination links of the data tables, for example on the dashboard in the "As-signed to me" area,
 ▪ the drop-down links of the sections with the output "Number Link",
 ▪ the "Share" link without labeling, for example the issue view. "

→ Links must be clearly marked. In particular, links that are implemented without text using graphics, icons or SVG require an alternative designation, for example using an <alt> or <arial-label> attribute.
fields.summary: Some links are not clearly labeled.

fields.description:
The gray background of the active navigation point has a contrast value of 1.2: 1 compared to the white background of the unselected navigation points and is therefore not clearly recognizable.
 → The marking of the active menu item should be made clearer. It is recommended to choose a shade of gray for the marking that provides a greater contrast to the white background. Alternatively, a framework would be an improvement here.
fields.summary: The position within a project is difficult to identify.

fields.description:
Motor-impaired users navigate through an application with the keyboard. In order to be able to orientate yourself, you depend above all on the fact that the tabulator focus is clearly visible on the interactive elements. The focus is barely visible on many links, as the font color is only slightly darkened. Since a lot of links are affected, e.g. all links in issue lists and issue detail forms, users with restricted mobility cannot orient themselves in the application. The operation of the application is considerably more difficult for them.
 For menu items of the closed navigation menu (see illustration, navigation menu on the left), a tooltip is displayed when the focus is retained so that the focused element can be recognized. When the navigation menu is opened, however, the focus on the menu items is not visible.
fields.summary: The keyboard focus is difficult to recognize on some elements.

fields.description:
People with motor disabilities often cannot use the mouse and instead use the tab key to navigate through applications. If the tab order does not correspond to the visual representation and the logical processing order, it is difficult for the user to work efficiently. Even blind people who cannot access visual cues to correctly capture the navigation structure are dependent on a logical tabulator order. In this context, the following problems were identified:

On many pages, content is not reached in the visual and logical order. Orientation and navigation are made more difficult for users with limited mobility. For blind users, it is more difficult to assign interactive elements to the content. For example, the elements are affected:
 ▪ Preview area of ​​the backlog on the right-hand side.
 ▪ The buttons "Only my Issues" and "Recently Updated" of the backlog are reached in front of the search field.
 ▪ The buttons “Share”, “Export” and Tools in the search are reached before the heading.
 ▪ The control elements in the project overview of the dashboard are reached before the project name link.
 ▪ The control elements in the header area of ​​the activity areas are always reached last (within the activity area), for example in the user profile (not shown) or in the issue view.
 ▪ The buttons for changing the issue within the issue view are reached as the last elements on the page.
 ▪ In the user profile, the number of open issues per project is reached before the project name (area "Assigned open issues per project", not shown)
 ▪ The shortcut message of the "Assign" window is only reached after the "Assign" and "Cancel" buttons. 

 

 

The operation of the selection list "More" in the issue view is not possible without restrictions for users with restricted mobility. If a user navigates to the options in this list with the arrow keys, the focus is removed from the list after the list element "At-tach files" and the following options cannot be reached. This means that users with limited motor skills must use the points menu in order to be able to operate these functions. For blind users, this problem is not weighted because the selection lists cannot be used.

 

 

 
 Some elements that can be edited inline receive focus but cannot be activated (see illustration). Keyboard users have to navigate through these elements with additional effort. 
  
  
 The keyboard focus cannot be set in the toolbar of the Richtext editor. This means that keyboard users cannot format text.
  
 A keyboard user is only able to use three elements from the toolbar with a keyboard combination to a very limited extent. This applies to the functions "bold", "oblique" and "underlined", which can be executed using Ctrl b, Ctrl i and Ctrl u. All other functions either do not have a key combination or the key combination is already used for something else by the browser. Getting the keyboard focus into the bar is not possible.
 → The toolbar should be accessible with the tab key and operated using the arrow keys, space key and enter key.
fields.summary: The order of focus does not partly correspond to the visual and logical order.

fields.description:
How efficient keyboard users work depends largely on the design of the keyboard navigation. The following problems arise:
 ▪ Large groups of interactive elements, such as the menu, must be tabbed through on each page. As a result, the users very often repeat the same action over and over again: tabbing over all links, for example to reach the content. This restricts targeted and fast navigation in the content for users with restricted mobility (see illustration).
 ▪ The problem for blind users is that the arrow key navigation between the problem list and the detail view does not work (see figure, marker A).
 ▪ If the focus is set back on the list from the detail view, the first element of the list is not focused on, but rather on the last element. Motor-restricted users have to navigate with additional effort to the last focused element
fields.summary: Larger element groups cannot be skipped efficiently.

fields.description:
The contents of the table can be perceived in a structured manner. Blind users do not have this option. Among other things, you use the column headings to get an idea of the structure of the table, which is the basis for meaningful access to the data it contains. The following problems occur:
 ▪ The content in the "Sub-Tasks" area in the task view is implemented in a table without column labels (see figure). Blind users will find it more difficult to grasp the content.
 ▪ The contents of the Printable View are also implemented in data tables without column labels.

 
 Basically, all tables lack a table name that is marked with the <caption> element. Overall, the table structures are too complex and confusing in many places. Most of the column structures are missing.
  
 → All tables require a name using the <caption> element and meaningful column headings using the <th> element.
 → With the sometimes very complex table structures, it should be checked whether the tables should actually be layout tables. These can then be implemented accordingly using <table role = “none“>.
fields.summary: The column labels of some tables are not correctly marked.

fields.description:
List elements are used to structure content, for example in a list. Their identification offers blind users an additional indication of the structure of the page and offers additional navigation options. In this way, blind users can navigate specifically to the lists on a page or across them. In the application, however, there are some problems related to lists:
 ▪ Lists are not used consistently. Much of the content is implemented using list elements. However, not all visually related content is contained in one list, but two or more lists are used for structuring. This makes orientation and navigation more difficult for blind users

▪ Many lists consist of only one list element, which in turn contains definition lists. This means that the structure is difficult to see for blind users .

▪ The problem arises here that the definition lists again consist of only one entry, so the screen reader output a lot of additional content when navigating linearly, since one list is always left and a new one is reached . This problem also occurs, for example, in the user settings.

▪ Individual operating elements that belong together are not implemented as a list, for example the operating elements for editing an issue. Blind users cannot perceive this grouping.
 Note: The problems described here occur on all pages of the application and should also be addressed for all pages.
 ▪ The entries in the "Activity" area and the pagination of content are not implemented as lists .
fields.summary: The structure of lists makes it difficult for blind users to capture content efficiently.

fields.description:
h4. *Summary*

Blind users need information about the purpose of each form field so that they can process it specifically. However, screen readers cannot correctly output the labels of form elements for the following reasons:
 ▪ Two elements in the preview area of ​​the Active Sprint are not linked to the visual labeling. Screen reader users must determine the function of the elements from the context (see figure).
 ▪ Further examples of form fields whose labels are not output are rich text editors (see illustration).
 ▪ Search fields are not labeled and are output by the screen reader without labeling. This makes it difficult for blind users to recognize the function of these elements. All types of search fields are affected, for example the search field in the backlog (see Figure 2-32) and the issues (see Issues> Search for Issues, not shown).
 ▪ Under "Components" the search field is labeled with a placeholder text (see illustration). However, this is not meaningful, and a placeholder labeling of an element is defined as insufficient by the W3C per specification.
 ▪ In the "Log Work" pop-up (accessed via the "+" icon in the "Time Tracking" area of ​​an issue), some elements are not correctly labeled, e.g. the input fields for the radio button options “Set to” and “Reduce by” (see figure). To make matters worse, there is no labeling for the two radio buttons (despite correct linkage in the source code). One possible cause is that the dynamic change from non-editable to editable text fields when selecting the radio buttons is superimposed on the screen reader output.

▪ Under User Profile > Accessibility, the reference links are titled "Show me" and do not describe the pages they are linking to. 

 
 In the preview view, the fields are not linked to the labels (see illustration).
  The text entry field in the editor is not linked to its “Description” label, see next figure.
 Various search fields in different areas are without lettering.

*Diagnosis*

Review the guidelines for link titles:
 * [https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/navigation-mechanisms-refs.html]

There are various places in Jira where the link text does not follow these guidelines.  This is important for visually impaired users using screen readers.
fields.summary: Some elements are not labeled or are not labeled correctly.

fields.description:
→ If the <h1> heading should read "All Sprints", the <h1> element must also enclose the text "All Sprints".
 → The headings structured with <h6> must be marked with <h2>. Formats are to be adapted using CSS.
 → The additional <h1> label "Jira-Software" in the upper navigation bar is not a meaningful heading and must be removed.

 

 
 → If the <h1> heading is to read "Backlog", the <h1> element must also be positioned around the text "Backlog" and must not include other elements.
  
 The subordinate headings are all structured with <h3> and <h4>, but the correct sequence in the structure would be <h2> and <h3>. In addition, the detail area starts with <h4> and in between a heading is marked with <h3>. The sub-headings are completely missing in the main area. It is not possible for screen reader users to recognize a meaningful heading structure.
 → The substructure must be completely labeled with hierarchically correct headings from <h2>.
 → The additional <h1> label "Jira-Software" in the upper navigation bar is not a meaningful heading and must be removed.
 → Findings of this kind extend over the entire application and basically have to be improved almost everywhere.
fields.summary: Some headings are not used hierarchically correctly.

fields.description:
As a Jira admin I'd to have the hability to integrate between Microsoft Graph API and Jira incoming Mail handles.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/api/message-get?view=graph-rest-1.0&tabs=http

Some customers are reporting that IMAP and POP are being deprecated inside their network, so they would be without any options to configure Jira mail handlers.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we delete users from LDAP, they are set as inactive in Jira if they have any references, and deleted otherwise.

But when the references are:
 * Watch an issue
 * Vote for an issue
 * Log work
 * Transition a state

Jira will delete the user, leaving the reference broken.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a user to LDAP;
 # Sync so it shows up in Jira;
 # Log in the user;
 # Perform one of these actions:
 ** Watch an issue
 ** Vote for an issue
 ** Log work
 ** Transition a state
 # Delete the user from LDAP;
 # Sync the LDAP directory.

h3. Expected Results

Either:
 * The users should be set as inactive;
 * Or the entries should be cleaned up.

h3. Actual Results

The users are removed, leaving behind broken entries.
 * Watcher:
!image-2020-10-07-17-18-04-660.png|width=197,height=145!
 * Voter:
!image-2020-10-07-17-19-58-154.png!
 * Work log:
!image-2020-10-07-17-21-35-389.png!
 * History:
!image-2020-10-07-17-21-23-229.png!

h3. Workaround

If you wish for a user to be made inactive, please ensure that at least one comment was made by that user.
fields.summary: Deleting users in LDAP don't set them as inactive

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
'membersOf' function does not properly support "WAS IN" and other keywords.

Using function 'membersOf' throws error when using 'assignee was in' clause, likely due to inactive users. Although the JQL function does usually give results with active users and "WAS IN" keyword, these keywords are not supported to use with this function and there is no guarantee that it will work properly.

Applying the JQL query returns the following error:
{code}
A value provided by the function 'membersOf' is invalid for the field 'assignee'.
{code}
 !image-2020-10-07-13-36-41-148.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested resolution
Implement proper support for "WAS IN" and other keywords listed on [Advanced searching \- functions reference \- Jira \- Atlassian documentation \-  membersOf()|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/advanced-searching-functions-reference-939938746.html#Advancedsearching-functionsreference-membersOfmembersOf()] documentation page, that are currently listed as unsupported.
fields.summary: Using function 'membersOf' throws error when using 'assignee was in' clause likely due to inactive users.

Affected versions of Atlassian Jira Server allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTML or JavaScript via a Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Jira issue filter export files.

The affected versions are before version 8.5.9, from version 8.6.0 before 8.12.3, and from version 8.13.0 before 8.13.1.

*Affected versions:*

 * version < 8.5.9
 * 8.6.0 ≤ version < 8.12.3
 * 8.13.0 ≤ version < 8.13.1

*Fixed versions:*

 * 8.5.9
 * 8.12.3
 * 8.13.1
 * 8.14.0
fields.summary: XSS in Jira issue filter export file via malicious full name - CVE-2020-14184

h3. Issue Summary

After archiving an issue development panel on issue view disappears.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect Jira with Bitbucket
 # Create an issue
 # Check issue view -> verify if development panel on right side is visible
 # Archive this issue
 # Check issue view -> verify if development panel on right side is visible

h3. Expected Results

5. Development panel is visible
h3. Actual Results

The Import of Jira-Projects into a Jira-Instance can fail due to not available user that can not be created. In some cases this could be due to corrupted/inkonsistent data (see [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/project-import-failed-due-to-blank-missing-mandatory-user-865045675.html])

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user goes to change the project lead no drop down menu is available which is not user friendly. To activate the drop down menu, a user has to start typing a name. This isn't intuitive to users. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Project > Project Settings > Users & Roles > Edit Defaults 
 # When you click to change the lead "No options" shows in the drop down menu bar which leaves users to think there are no users to choose from 
 # Only when a user starts typing then you can see there are options

h3. Expected Results

When you click on the Project Lead bar to change the user you would expect to see "start typing to find users" or see users in a drop down menu
h3. Actual Results

The menu bar says "No options" which is not true. The options are hidden
h3. Workaround

The user needs to start typing a name to activate name options

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The 'Grant permission' popup within the Permission Scheme edit page is no longer responsive based on browser/window size, resulting in the options under 'Show more' bleeding out of the container and onto the main page.

This issue was introduced in *8.12.0* and is not occurring in *8.11.X*.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to '*Jira Administration -> Issues -> Permission schemes*'.
 # Select '*Permissions*' under the '*Actions*' column of any permission scheme.
 # Select '*Grant permissions*'.
 # Choose '*Show More*' to display all available grant options.
 # Resize the window vertically until the options bleed into the main page.
 ## Or open your browser developer tools and drag it up.

h3. Expected Results

!PopupCorrect.png|width=342,height=142!
h3. Actual Results

!PopupWrong.png|width=329,height=188!
h3. Workaround
h6. Option 1

Resize browser window vertically until all options are visible.
h6. Option 2

Utilize [browser zoom|https://www.wikihow.com/Zoom-With-a-Web-Browser] functionality to zoom out until all options are visible.
fields.summary: 'Grant permission' popup is no longer Responsive

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The {{jira.advanced.audit.log.migration.limit}} configuration property has no effect.

This setting is intended to limit the amount of rows migrated as part of the [Jira 8.8 Advanced Audit log|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/audit-log-improvements-989762528.html] [migration task|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-8-8-x-upgrade-notes-990550394.html]. This migration task moves data from {{audit_log}}, {{audit_item}} and {{audit_changed_value}} to the new table {{AO_C77861_AUDIT_ENTITY}}
h4. Why this property is useful

The property should restrict the amount of entries that are migrated to the Advanced Audit Log system.

The migration task should not block the usage of Jira, however there are reports that the task is blocking the usage of Jira for non-ZDU deployment in JRASERVER-71075

This feature could be a valuable asset for customer with large audit log row count to minimise time taken to upgrade.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On Jira version <8.8.0 (eg 8.5.5) create a project called TEST
 # Create many audit log entries. Example Script:
{code:java}
#!/bin/bash

COUNTER=0
while [ $COUNTER -lt 1200 ]; do
    echo Made $COUNTER
    PAYLOAD='{"name": "New Version '$COUNTER'", "description": "Desc", "project":"TEST"}'
    curl -w "%{http_code}" -s -o /dev/null -u admin:admin http://allewelljira:8855/rest/api/2/version -X POST --data "$PAYLOAD"  -H "Content-Type: application/json"
    echo 
    let COUNTER++
done{code}

 # Create or modify JIRA_HOME/jira-config.properties with:
{code:java}
jira.advanced.audit.log.migration.limit = 10{code}

 # Shutdown Jira
 # Upgrade Jira installation to version >8.8.0, example, 8.12.0
 # Start Jira to initiate upgrade

h3. Expected Results
 * Around 10 rows are migrated
 ** 
{code:java}
select count(*) from "AO_C77861_AUDIT_ENTITY" {code}

 * 10 previous history is shown in Jira Admin -> System -> Audit Log (/plugins/servlet/audit)
 * Logging from AuditingMigrator and AuditingMigratorLimitSupplier reports that limit is set to 10 rows

h3. Actual Results
 * All rows are migrated
{code:java}
select count(*) from "AO_C77861_AUDIT_ENTITY" {code}

 * All previous history is shown in Jira Admin -> System -> Audit Log (/plugins/servlet/audit)
 * Logging from AuditingMigrator and AuditingMigratorLimitSupplier reports that limit is 10000000 / 9999000
{code:java}
2020-09-29 12:45:42,344+1000 Caesium-1-3 INFO      [c.a.j.a.spis.migration.AuditingMigratorLimitSupplier] Computed max available record limit for audit log migration task (including minimum free record amount: 1000): 9999000
2020-09-29 12:45:42,346+1000 Caesium-1-3 INFO      [c.a.j.a.spis.migration.AuditingMigratorLimitSupplier] Already migrated record count: 0
2020-09-29 12:45:42,346+1000 Caesium-1-3 INFO      [c.a.j.a.spis.migration.AuditingMigratorLimitSupplier] Computed record limit for audit log migration task (including minimum free record amount: 1000): 9999000
2020-09-29 12:45:42,346+1000 Caesium-1-3 INFO      [c.a.j.a.spis.migration.AuditingMigrator] ==== starting audit migration (batch size 2000, record limit 9999000) ====
2020-09-29 12:45:42,350+1000 Caesium-1-3 INFO      [c.a.j.a.spis.migration.AuditingMigrator] audit log count 1083
2020-09-29 12:45:42,351+1000 Caesium-1-3 INFO      [c.a.j.a.spis.migration.AuditingMigrator] == starting batch processing (1/1) ==
2020-09-29 12:45:42,460+1000 Caesium-1-3 INFO      [c.a.j.a.spis.migration.AuditingMigrator] Storing entities
2020-09-29 12:45:42,530+1000 Caesium-1-3 DEBUG      [c.a.activeobjects.osgi.ActiveObjectsServiceFactory] getService bundle [com.atlassian.audit.atlassian-audit-plugin]
2020-09-29 12:45:42,667+1000 Caesium-1-3 INFO      [c.a.j.a.spis.migration.AuditingMigrator] Storing entities done
2020-09-29 12:45:42,705+1000 Caesium-1-3 INFO      [c.a.j.a.spis.migration.AuditingMigratorLimitSupplier] Already migrated record count: 0
2020-09-29 12:45:42,715+1000 Caesium-1-3 INFO      [c.a.j.a.spis.migration.AuditingMigrator] == ending batch processing (1/1). Took 363.5 ms ==
2020-09-29 12:45:42,715+1000 Caesium-1-3 INFO      [c.a.j.a.spis.migration.AuditingMigrator] ==== ending audit migration (batch size 2000). Took 369.4 ms ====
2020-09-29 12:45:42,721+1000 Caesium-1-3 INFO      [c.a.upgrade.core.DefaultUpgradeTaskFactoryProcessor] Upgrade task [factory=com.atlassian.audit.atlassian-audit-plugin,buildNumber=1] completed in 378 milliseconds
{code}

h3. Workaround

Provide the property directly as a command line argument or via {{setenv.sh }}\ {{setenv.bat}} file. Example:
{code:java}
JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS="-Djira.advanced.audit.log.migration.limit=10"{code}
fields.summary: The jira.advanced.audit.log.migration.limit configuration property has no effect

fields.description:
Currently, there are security advisories and security reports in Jira.atlassian.com, but when a Jira admin is looking for all the security issues that affect the version they are using it becomes difficult and time-consuming as it requires:
# Finding all the security advisories, check each one and see if their version is affected.
# Going to Jira.atlassian.com and making a search filter with the security label, and due to the nature of the field "Affected versions" a Jira version might be affected but not be indicated in the bug report (let's say that Jira 8.5.3 is affected but the report only has been done in 8.5.4), and since the real versions affected are not included in the bug reports, only the versions that have actually been reported, and due to the fact that there no way to search for versions "newer than" or "older than", it becomes an unreliable way to check for vulnerabilities.

The suggestion is to provide a web page, or a feature in Jira to easily obtain the list of security issues that are affecting an instance.

This request can also be extended to all the Atlassian server products.
fields.summary: Provide a user friendly way to identify security issues in a specific version of Jira.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you add a condition to a Workflow Transition while also saving that Transition to a new destination Status while Jira Data Center is under load, it results in a corrupted Workflow XML and the Workflows page will subsequently fail to load. 

_Bug for result_: JRASERVER-68050 - Broken XML causes workflow admin page to crash
h3. Steps to Reproduce

_Unable to reproduce in sandbox as this requires Jira Data Center under load conditions._
 1. Edit a Workflow Diagram in Chrome browser, say on Tab 1
 2. Click on a workflow transition arrow (say TRANSITION-1) - various options available for the transition appears on the right
 3. Right click on Conditions and click open in a new tab, say on Tab 2
 4. On Tab 1, change either the source or destination of TRANSITION-1. Do not click save yet.
 5. On Tab 2, click 'add condition' -> select 'User Is In Any Groups (JSU)' -> scroll & select a desired group under 'Available groups' section -> click 'Add >>' button which shows the group under "Allowed groups" section -> Click 'Add' at the bottom
 6. Simultaneously, in a quick succession, On Tab 1, click 'Save' button
h3. Expected Results

The Workflow will save with both the new Condition and the new Transition destination Status. 
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2020-09-08 https-jsse-nio-8443-exec-11 ERROR /rest/workflowDesigner/latest/workflows [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: java.lang.RuntimeException: com.opensymphony.workflow.FactoryException: Error converting XML to workflow descriptor.: root cause: Duplicate occurance of action ID 11 found in step 7
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

The fix is documented here: 
 * [Fixing workflows with duplicate occurrance of actions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/fixing-workflows-with-duplicate-occurance-of-action-781386551.html]

Although the corrupted Worklow result was documented, as well as the fix, the cause has not been documented, therefore we opened this bug.
fields.summary: Adding a Condition while simultaneously changing a Transition on a Workflow results in a corrupted Workflow

fields.description:
I need a column that is between the backlog and the sprint.

Call it "Ready for Development" or "Defined" or whatever.

The Backlog is where new requirements land.

The "Defined/Ready for Development" column is where they move after they have been force ranked and estimated.

Sprint planning involves pulling from the "Defined/Ready for Development".

Having this ability is a huge benefit to managing the project and should be considered a mandatory feature.
fields.summary: Allow the creation of a "Defined" or "Ready for Development" column outside the sprint.

 * Also another thing to note here is that we don't get an error when the issue is assigned using *assign* option but we get the error when the issue is assigned using *assignee* option

h3. Steps to Reproduce

I have all steps to replicate the issue above and a few more screenshot given below

You are not allowed to see the issue is correct but Failed to save the issue number is incorrect 
h3. Actual Results

Incorrect error message displayed creates confusion
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

No workaround available

fields.description:
✓ The Windows colors from high contrast mode are adopted in Firefox.
 Google Chrome does not support the use of Windows colors, which is why settings such as high-contrast mode do not work.

 

→ A separate style switcher with high-contrast mode could be integrated into the application, which users can activate and configure themselves if necessary.
 → The users must be informed at a suitable point (e.g. on the start page / dashboard) that the high-contrast add-on from Google Chrome must be installed in order to have a high-contrast mode in Google Chrome.
 → The users must be informed at a suitable point (e.g. on the start page / dashboard) that Mozilla Firefox has a high-contrast mode that supports Windows colors. Both browsers are available for Telekom employees.
fields.summary: Users cannot adapt contrasts to their needs.

fields.description:
✓ The contrast of the lettering in the backlog is now sufficient .
 The yellow bar and the yellow number do not provide sufficient contrast on a white background.
 → The yellow bar and the yellow number should be realized in a different color that offers sufficient contrast (at least 3: 1 for the beacon, 4.5: 1 for normal text).
 → The contrast can either be tested with an online contrast analysis program (e.g. "Lumi-nosity Color Contrast Ratio Analyzer") or with the "Color Contrast Analyzer" tool and a more suitable color can be selected.
fields.summary: Some content contrast distances are too small.

fields.description:
The progress bars are implemented with the help of CSS and consist only of colored bars that are only output "empty" by the screen reader.

 

✓ The date is shown in red in some lines. This highlighting is based on the date and is therefore not the only information carrier.
 ✓ The contrasts of the colors are sufficient to the white background.
 ! In the case of a single-colored bar, namely when all issues have the status "open" or "closed", users with color blindness cannot assign this status.
 → Since the highlighting by color alone (without additional semantics) cannot be correctly recognized by screen readers or color-blind users, there must always be another distinguishing feature, for example a small icon with a meaningful alternative text.

 
 The display of the summary of the sprint is always structured in the same way. Assuming that the meaning of the position is known, the assignment of the content can be recognized even without color perception.
 Note: Additional information is given via tooltip on the number of issues per sprint, but this is not output for screen readers, since neither the numbers themselves can be accessed with the keyboard (see result 1), nor the tooltips (since they are used as Attribute are realized). If this problem is corrected, the meaning of the position can be seen from the tooltips.
 → So that the status numbers can be better perceived by the screen reader, they must be included in the focus sequence.
 → The tooltips must be designed to be keyboard-operated for users with restricted mobility.
  
 The bars merely represent a length of time that is measured in days, which is also indicated by the abbreviation “d”. The terms "Estimated", "Remaining" and "Logged" provide sufficient information about the different values. The color coding of the bars has no additional meaning. In addition, the same information is given via tooltip.
 ✓ Screen reader users get all the necessary information (in reading mode) read aloud in order to correctly interpret the content.
fields.summary: Much information is conveyed solely through color

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Remote JIRA Issue Link should update the issue key and URL when remote JIRA issue is moved

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create project A1 and A2 in Jira Server A
2. Create issue A1-1 in Jira Server A
3. Create project B1 in Jira Cloud B
4. Create issue B1-1 in Jira Cloud B
5. Create a remote link to link A1-1 with B1-1 
6. Now, in Jira Server A, issue A1-1 is moved to project A2, which becomes issue A2-1.

h3. Expected Results
We expected that B1-1 should now point to A2-1 instead of A1-1.

h3. Actual Results
We can see clearly that at step 6, Jira Server does not make the call to the cloud one to update the link.

h3. Workaround
none.
fields.summary: Remote JIRA Issue Link should update the issue key and URL when remote JIRA issue is moved

fields.summary: Custom fields should maintain their inputted value when changing issue type

fields.description:
Hi,

Today we upgraded our staging Jira server from 7.13 to 8.5 as a precursor practice for the upcoming upgrading on production server next month.

Everything went on smoothly, except that the upgrade package atlassian-jira-software-8.5.8-x64.bin shows the avatar file names during the process, which is a nuisance.

# We cloned everything from the production system to this staging system a couple months ago so that we could do the stress test. Understandably, this system now has a huge lot of accounts / avatars, just like the production system has.
# A huge portion of our engineers using the system are Chinese and Japanese. So most of them tend to name their avatar filenames using Chinese / Japanese characters.
# Our Jira server is hosted on AWS EC2 node which runs CentOS. We use PuTTY to log on it and do the maintenance, upgrading included.
# Clearly the Linux TTY console knows nothing about Chinese / Japanese characters. So those characters are just misinterpreted as control characters.

So when the upgrade package was doing its thing and showing those supposedly avatar file names, all strange gibberish popped up everywhere in the terminal and the cursor was moving to all directions like it was possessed. Though it might be entertaining (which it really was), what bothered us the most is that we could hardly know it actually stopped and asked us whether we wish to start Jira or exit (the last stage of upgrading) because the message was embedded in the middle of a screen full of "funny" characters.

Also, I can understand the need to show the Jira bundled files such as those JAR files, etc, so that if anything goes wrong we could see where it stops. But showing avatar file names really doesn't help much (they are provided by the users anyway, and they are plain data in a sense). I would suggest future Jira upgrade package should instead show a percentage of the portion of total avatar files being processed, not showing each one of their names.

Thank you for reading thus far. Hope you guys can consider this enhancement on future upgrade package. Hope you and your family are doing well!

Best Regards
Tony Chu
TrendMicro TW HQ
fields.summary: Please show progress in percentage for upgrade instead of file names

Some graphics do not have alternative text.

fields.description:
Screen readers evaluate the source code of the application and output it for a blind user. Since no or insufficient information was stored here for various contents, the output is not understandable.

 

It is still difficult to recognize options that have already been selected in the multiple selection list.

→ The relatively complicated handling and the special format of the input field must be better described, especially for blind users. For example, the label could be expanded to include a note that is only accessible to screen readers.
 → Components that are available in the field and selected using the arrow keys (left and right) should be expanded to include the addition “Delete with Remove”, which is only accessible for screen readers.

 

 

The "..." button is read out as "Reduced menu link", which indicates that the role "Link" is recognized and the menu is not opened. However, the name of the element is missing, the finding still persists.

 

→ The "..." switch must contain a designation that can be implemented using the aria label attribute (e.g. aria label = "Additional functions").
 → The role of the switch must be changed from Link to Button so that keyboard operation is also possible with an active screen reader. 

 

Completed tickets are marked as "crossed out" using text formatting. This formatting remains hidden from screen reader users.

→ The respective link must be supplemented by an extension noticeable by the screen reader that indicates the status "Closed".

 

 

 

Some regions are still not clearly labeled.

→ The names of the landmarks should be sensible so that double navigation areas can be distinguished from one another → The names of the landmarks should be chosen sensibly so that double navigation areas can be distinguished from one another.
 → Main area could be subdivided more finely. Part of the main area would be a function menu, for example.
 → Main area could be subdivided more finely. Part of the main area would be a function menu, for example.

 

It is not clear which release is shown because the status of the toggle is not reported.

 

→ The current status of the switch should be marked with <… aria-pressed = “true / false”>.

 

 
 The column labels of a table on the dashboard are sometimes incomprehensible. Columns are labeled with "T" and "P" (see illustration). This means that the function is not understandable for blind users.
 The sorting direction of the table, for example in column “P”, is not output by the screen reader. Blind users can therefore not see the sorting.
 The following applies to both problems: The information is stored as title attributes, but these are not output by the screen reader.
  
 → The column headings must be designed in such a way that the associated column content and the sorting order are also understandable for screen reader users.
  
  
 The backlog is not implemented with structural elements. Blind users can therefore only navigate linearly through the content in order to recognize the structure.
  
 The color and functions of the numbers are still not recognizable. The numbers can only be accessed using the read-out mode, not the tab key.
  
 The separator between the times will continue to be output as a "bullet" by the screen reader.
 The graphics are output in an incomprehensible manner (file names).
  
 ▪ The numbers of the issues in the header area of a sprint must be more accessible via the keyboard and have an explanatory designation according to the current title.
 ▪ A "-" is usually used as a separator between two points in time that describe a period. However, no characters should be used here, but a graphic correctly labeled with a text alternative.
 ▪ The graphics require a meaningful description in the <alt> attribute.
fields.summary: Some content is difficult or impossible to grasp for screen reader users.

fields.description:
Blind users rely on the screen reader to recognize which interactive elements are used in an application and what their current status is. In the application, this is not the case with many elements, so that blind users cannot operate the following elements:

▪ Drop-down lists that are linked to <button> elements: The role is displayed correctly when the buttons are reached, e.g. "More ... switch", when activated, the focus is also set in the input field, but there is no output.With arrow navigation the list elements are not output, but the neighboring elements. Letter entries are not transferred to the input field in read mode (see picture1, marking B).

 

▪ Drop-down lists that are linked to <div> elements and event handlers: When the <div> elements are reached, the screen reader gives e.g. "Type colon all". The roll is not issued. It is not possible to open it with the keyboard (see picture1, marking A). "

 

 

→ The drop-down lists have to be extended by the attribute <aria-haspopup> so that the screen-enreader can perceive and output the drop-down function.
→ The "Checkbox" role is to be assigned to the list entries. The text entries correspond to the labeling of the checkbox and are assigned to the checkboxes as labels.

 

→ The relatively complicated handling and the special format of the input field must be better described, especially for blind users. For this purpose, the label could, for example, be extended by a note that is only accessible to screen readers, e.g. B. with an aria label attribute.

 

→ Components that are available in the field and selected using the arrow keys (left and right) should be expanded to include the addition “Delete with Remove”, which is only accessible for screen readers.
fields.summary: The roles of some important elements are difficult to identify.

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
We can confirm after a conversation with the DEV team, there is *no support* for server querying of the *JIRA REST API* with *JWT* authentication.
The DEV team is working to implement *oAuth2.0* for the Jira server, but currently, only *Jira cloud* has support for *JWT*.

h3. Suggested Solution
(?) Can we have a feature that makes Jira consume JWT token for REST APIs usage?

Something similar to the JWT authentication which is being used on Jira Cloud, but, in preference something more "generic" that users can integrate with their own apps.

We can see it's implemented for Confluence as well: [https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/How-to-make-REST-API-endpoints-available-for-JWT-authentication/]
fields.summary: As an user, I want to use JIRA REST API with JWT authentication

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Deleting components that have been archived does not remove the Issue association from the nodeassociation table.

This can lead to gadgets showing a different number of issues without components than what's seen in the Issue navigator.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a component to an issue
 # Archive the component
 # Delete the component

h3. Expected Results

Component is deleted and any association to it is removed
h3. Actual Results

Component is deleted but nodeassociation table still has the link between the issues and component.
h3. Workaround
 # Delete the orphaned rows manually with the SQL query below
{code:SQL}delete from nodeassociation where source_node_entity = 'Issue' and sink_node_entity = 'Component' and sink_node_id not in (select id from component);{code}
 # Reindex Jira
fields.summary: Deleting archived component leaves orphan issue association

fields.description:
In the document [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-advanced-settings-938847828.html], it says:
|jira.text.field.character.limit|This property limits the number of characters that can be entered into *Description*, *Environments,* *Comments* and *text custom fields.* The maximum is 2147483647. A value of 0 means unlimited characters.|

The part that regards text custom fields could be misleading.
 * Single line text custom fields are *not* impacted by this variable and are always limited to 255 characters.
 * Multi-line text custom fields will have the max length defined by this variable.

So, my suggestion is:
|jira.text.field.character.limit|This property limits the number of characters that can be entered into *Description*, *Environments,* *Comments* and *multi-line text custom fields.* The maximum is 2147483647. A value of 0 means unlimited characters.|
fields.summary: Update document part regarding jira.text.field.character.limit

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When setting a date format with a long year format (e.g *dd.MM.yyyy*) and manually inserting a date with a short year format (for instance 15.12.19) in a date picker field, the date gets inserted as of 2 days earlier (in this example 13.12.19). This is similar to the issue reported in JRASERVER-36354 but we can see here that the date is inconsistent.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to _Administration > General Configuration > Advanced_.
 # Set the *jira.date.picker.java.format* to *dd.MM.yyyy*.
 !DatePickerFormat.png|width=215,height=92!
 # Create or edit an issue and manually type a number date in a date picker field (e.g the Due Date field) with format *dd.mm.yy* such as 15.12.19 for example and save the change.
 !TestDateFormat.png|width=189,height=183!

h3. Expected Results

The inserted value should be rejected since it doesn't respect the format specified in Jira, or should be accepted as it is *15.12.19*, or converted to a long-year-format *15.12.2019*. 
Note from triage: When you put "21.03.21" and edit again the date there is "19.03.0021" and this may be the cause of the problem. 
h3. Actual Results

The date inserted shows as of 2 days earlier i.e *13.12.19*.
 !WrongTestDateFormat.png|width=307,height=141!
h3. Note

This issue happens with any date format where Jira expects *yyyy* but the year inserted is in the short format *yy.*
h3. Workaround

As a workaround, you may use scripted fields and validate the insertion or date picker fields provided by plugins.
fields.summary: No validation and wrong date when manually inserting an unexpected year format in a date picker field

fields.description:
As a search user, I would like to be able to configure multiple "presets" of columns so that when searching I can quickly see the search results using the columns I need instead of wasting time re-defining my personal defaults or saving a filter.

Selecting columns in issue navigator is a poor experience for a number of reasons, and unfortunately is something most intermediate+ users will need to do on a regular basis. It would be extremely useful to be able to set up pre-defined sets of columns so that when searching for, lets say epics, I could quickly select the group of columns valuable to see when looking at epics.
fields.summary: Column Presets for Issue Navigator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While clicking on "✕" (cross mark) to delete "non-working days" in a board has no result
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on "Boards" in the top navigating bar
 # Choose a board and click on the "Board" option in the right side corner and click on "Configure"
# Now click on "Working days" under configurations 
# Try to add a non working date.
# Try to delete it as mentioned in the KB for [Configuring working days|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/configuring-working-days-938845342.html]
(!) This behaviour is not reproducible in jira 8.8.1 and we have also adjected the timezone as per this [KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/unable-to-delete-non-working-day-779158826.html] but same results.

h3. Expected Results

The existing non-working date should be deleted when we click on "✕" (cross mark)
h3. Actual Results
There's no response from jira and there is no response & nothing happens when we click on 
"✕" (cross mark)

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: While clicking on "✕" (cross mark) to delete "non-working days" in a board has no result

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Every time coming back from edit view of checkbox, the view more count for folded options will change.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Created a checkbox custom field with below options:
 ** AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA1
 ** AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA2
 ** ...
 ** AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA9
 ** AAAAAAAAAAAAAA10
 * Associate it with screens
 * Created a ticket with checked options: AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA1 ~ AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA6
 * In ticket view, click pencil in the checkbox to edit the checkbox options.
 * Change nothing , click × (or the area besides edit area), back from edit view.
 * A view more count for folded options will be shown, for example it is 4.
 * In ticket view, click pencil(to edit) again, change nothing , click × (or the area besides edit area), back from edit view.
 * The view more count for folded options will change to 5(plus 1).
 * If doing _edit > change nothing > back_ for the checkbox repeatedly, the view more count will keep increase.

h3. Expected Results

The view more count keeps same every time back from edit view, since there is no change. 
h3. Actual Results

The view more count will keep increase.
h3. Workaround

No Workaround, but no harm except the showing number is not correct.
fields.summary: View more count for folded options of checkbox is incorrect

fields.description: It would be useful to allow us to customize which types of issues are shown in QuickSearch - this is similar to wanting to limit which projects are returned by QuickSearch (JRACLOUD-15306).
fields.summary: Customize Issue Types returned in QuickSearch

fields.description:
In older versions of Jira such as Jira 7.8.x (even as new as 8.5.4), the top area of issue navigator contains the total issue count and a refresh icon.  
!image-2020-09-22-21-27-24-201.png|thumbnail! 

However, in more recent version such as 8.11.x, this is no longer the case. Instead, it only shows at the bottom of the page.
 !image-2020-09-22-21-28-44-466.png|thumbnail! 

We would like to ask that total issue count and refresh icon appears on the top too.
fields.summary: Bring back issue count and refresh on top of screen in issue navigator

fields.description:
If content is not specified in a logical order in the source code, screen reader users cannot establish contextual connections and a meaningful reading order of the content is not given. This may mean that makes it difficult to operate and understand the structure of the application.

 

Blind users cannot see which issue is displayed in which column of the active sprint because visual labels and swimlanes are implemented in structurally independent lists. As a result, all headings and then all swimlanes are output by the screen reader when navigating linearly. Since there is no information stored for the individual issues as to which column of the board they are assigned to, the status of an issue is no longer recognizable for blind users (see picture1).

 

A blind user is not able to see the column position of the current box within a swim lane.

→ The entire structure must be presented in a way that enables the individual columns in the swimlanes to be assigned to the higher-level headings. This could be done by representation in a data table.
 → Alternatively, the issues could be related to the swim lanes using hidden, screen-reader-accessible information on the issue boxes.

 

 → The order of the objects must be adapted for the logically correct sequence of the keyboard control.
fields.summary: Position of the issue in the sprintboard not recognizable
